Enum.name: FPVIOL_0

Enum.description: Protection violation detected

Enum.name: ACCERR_0
Enum.description: No access error detected

Enum.description: Access error detected

Enum.name: RDCOLERR_0
Enum.description: No collision error detected

Enum.name: RDCOLERR_1
Enum.description: Collision error detected

Enum.name: CCIF_0
Enum.description: Flash command in progress

Enum.name: CCIF_1
Enum.description: Flash command has completed

Enum.name: ERSSUSP_0
Enum.description: No suspend requested

Enum.name: ERSSUSP_1
Enum.description: Suspend the current Erase Flash Sector command execution.

Enum.name: ERSAREQ_0
Enum.description: No request or request complete

Enum.name: ERSAREQ_1
Enum.description: Request to: run the Erase All Blocks command, verify the erased state, program the security byte in the Flash Configuration Field to the unsecure state, and release MCU security by setting the FSEC[SEC] field to the unsecure state.

Enum.name: RDCOLLIE_0
Enum.description: Read collision error interrupt disabled

Enum.name: RDCOLLIE_1
Enum.description: Read collision error interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever a flash memory read collision error is detected (see the description of FSTAT[RDCOLERR]).

Enum.name: CCIE_0
Enum.description: Command complete interrupt disabled

Enum.name: CCIE_1
Enum.description: Command complete interrupt enabled. An interrupt request is generated whenever the FSTAT[CCIF] flag is set.

Enum.description: MCU security status is unsecure. (The standard shipping condition of the flash memory module is unsecure.)

Enum.name: SEC_3
Enum.description: MCU security status is secure.

BitField.description: DATALL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

BitField.description: DATAH stores the high 16 bits of the 16/32 bit CRC

BitField.name: DATAHU
BitField.description: DATAHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

BitField.description: POLYLL stores the second 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

BitField.name: GPOLYHL
BitField.description: POLYHL stores the third 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

BitField.name: GPOLYHU
BitField.description: POLYHU stores the fourth 8 bits of the 32 bit CRC

Enum.name: LDMOD_0
Enum.description: The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers, immediately after 1 is written to LDOK.

Enum.name: LDMOD_1
Enum.description: The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers when the PDB counter (CNT) = MOD + 1 CNT delay elapsed, after 1 is written to LDOK.

Enum.name: LDMOD_2
Enum.description: The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers when a trigger input event is detected, after 1 is written to LDOK.

Enum.name: LDMOD_3
Enum.description: The internal registers are loaded with the values from their buffers when either the PDB counter (CNT) = MOD + 1 CNT delay elapsed, or a trigger input event is detected, after 1 is written to LDOK.

Enum.description: PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger asserts when the counter reaches the channel delay register plus one peripheral clock cycle after a rising edge is detected on selected trigger input source or software trigger is selected and SWTRIG is written with 1.

Enum.name: TOS_0
Enum.description: PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger is in bypassed mode. The pre-trigger asserts one peripheral clock cycle after a rising edge is detected on selected trigger input source or software trigger is selected and SWTRIG is written with 1.

Enum.name: TOS_1

Enum.name: ERR_0
Enum.description: Sequence error not detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger.

Enum.name: ERR_1
Enum.description: Sequence error detected on PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger. ADCn block can be triggered for a conversion by one pre-trigger from PDB channel n. When one conversion, which is triggered by one of the pre-triggers from PDB channel n, is in progress, new trigger from PDB channel's corresponding pre-trigger m cannot be accepted by ADCn, and ERR[m] is set. Writing 0's to clear the sequence error flags.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

BitField.name: QUADIR
BitField.description: FTM Counter Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_0
Enum.description: Phase A and phase B encoding mode.

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase B input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase B input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_0
Enum.description: Normal polarity. Phase A input signal is not inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHAPOL_1
Enum.description: Inverted polarity. Phase A input signal is inverted before identifying the rising and falling edges of this signal.

Enum.name: PHBFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase B input filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_0
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is disabled.

Enum.name: PHAFLTREN_1
Enum.description: Phase A input filter is enabled.

Enum.description: FTM does not clear the TRIGj bit when the hardware trigger j is detected, where j = 0, 1,2.

BitField.name: TOFDIR
BitField.description: Timer Overflow Direction In Quadrature Decoder Mode

Enum.name: TOFDIR_0
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the bottom of counting. There was an FTM counter decrement and FTM counter changes from its minimum value (CNTIN register) to its maximum value (MOD register).

Enum.name: TOFDIR_1
Enum.description: TOF bit was set on the top of counting. There was an FTM counter increment and FTM counter changes from its maximum value (MOD register) to its minimum value (CNTIN register).

Enum.name: QUADIR_0
Enum.description: Counting direction is decreasing (FTM counter decrement).

Enum.name: QUADIR_1
Enum.description: Counting direction is increasing (FTM counter increment).

Enum.name: QUADMODE_1
Enum.description: Count and direction encoding mode.

Enum.description: Alternate clock 3 (ALTCLK3)

Enum.name: ADICLK_3
Enum.description: Alternate clock 4 (ALTCLK4)

Enum.name: MODE_0
Enum.description: 8-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_1
Enum.description: 12-bit conversion.

Enum.name: MODE_2
Enum.description: 10-bit conversion.

Enum.name: ADIV_0
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 1 and the clock rate is input clock.

Enum.name: ADIV_1
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 2 and the clock rate is (input clock)/2.

Enum.name: ADIV_2
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 4 and the clock rate is (input clock)/4.

Enum.name: ADIV_3
Enum.description: The divide ratio is 8 and the clock rate is (input clock)/8.

Enum.name: REFSEL_0
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: REFSEL_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: ACFE_0
Enum.description: Compare function disabled.

Enum.name: ACFE_1
Enum.description: Compare function enabled.

Enum.name: ADTRG_0
Enum.description: Software trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADTRG_1
Enum.description: Hardware trigger selected.

Enum.name: ADACT_0
Enum.description: Conversion not in progress.

Enum.name: ADACT_1
Enum.description: Conversion in progress.

Enum.name: AVGS_0
Enum.description: 4 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_1
Enum.description: 8 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_2
Enum.description: 16 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGS_3
Enum.description: 32 samples averaged.

Enum.name: AVGE_0
Enum.description: Hardware average function disabled.

Enum.name: AVGE_1
Enum.description: Hardware average function enabled.

Enum.name: ADCO_0
Enum.description: One conversion will be performed (or one set of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

Enum.name: ADCO_1
Enum.description: Continuous conversions will be performed (or continuous sets of conversions, if AVGE is set) after a conversion is initiated.

Enum.name: TCR_0
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32768 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_1
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32767 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_127
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32641 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_128
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32896 clock cycles.

Enum.name: TCR_255
Enum.description: Time Prescaler Register overflows every 32769 clock cycles.

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: Resets all RTC registers except for the SWR bit and the RTC_WAR and RTC_RAR registers . The SWR bit is cleared by POR and by software explicitly clearing it.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin is enabled and wakeup pin asserts if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.

Enum.name: NON_SUPPORTED
Enum.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are not supported and generate a bus error.

Enum.name: SUPPORTED
Enum.description: Non-supervisor mode write accesses are supported.

Enum.name: PROTECTED
Enum.description: Registers cannot be written when locked.

Enum.name: WRITEABLE
Enum.description: Registers can be written when locked under limited conditions.

Enum.name: ASSERTED
Enum.description: Wakeup pin asserts (active low, open drain) if the RTC interrupt asserts or the wakeup pin is turned on.

Enum.name: RTC_32KHZ
Enum.description: Wakeup pin instead outputs the RTC 32kHz clock, provided the wakeup pin is turned on and the 32kHz clock is output to other peripherals.

Enum.name: PRESCALER
Enum.description: The prescaler output clock (as configured by TSIC) is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: The RTC 32kHz clock is output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: CRYSTAL
Enum.description: RTC prescaler increments using 32 kHz clock.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: RTC prescaler increments using LPO, bits [4:0] of the prescaler are bypassed.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: 32.768 kHz oscillator is enabled. After setting this bit, wait the oscillator startup time before enabling the time counter to allow the 32.768 kHz clock time to stabilize.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The 32 kHz clock is allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The 32 kHz clock is not allowed to output on RTC_CLKOUT.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RTC_CLKOUT is disabled.

Enum.name: RTC_PTE0
Enum.description: RTC_CLKOUT is enabled.

Enum.name: VALID
Enum.description: Time is valid.

Enum.name: INVALID
Enum.description: Time is invalid and time counter is read as zero.

Enum.name: NOT_OCCURED
Enum.description: Time overflow has not occurred.

Enum.name: OCCURED
Enum.description: Time overflow has occurred and time counter is read as zero.

Enum.name: NOT_OCCURED
Enum.description: Time alarm has not occurred.

Enum.name: OCCURED
Enum.description: Time alarm has occurred.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time counter is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time counter is enabled.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Time Compensation Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Time Compensation Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Control Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Control Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Status Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Status Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: LOCKED
Enum.description: Lock Register is locked and writes are ignored.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: Lock Register is not locked and writes complete as normal.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time invalid flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time invalid flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time overflow flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time overflow flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Time alarm flag does not generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Time alarm flag does generate an interrupt.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Seconds interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Seconds interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: NO_EFFECT
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: ON
Enum.description: If the wakeup pin is enabled, then the wakeup pin will assert.

Enum.description: 1 Hz.

Enum.description: 2 Hz.

Enum.description: 4 Hz.

Enum.description: 8 Hz.

Enum.description: 16 Hz.

Enum.name: F32HZ
Enum.description: 32 Hz.

Enum.name: F64HZ

Register.name: LPTMR0_CSR
Register.description: Low Power Timer Control Status Register

Enum.name: TEN_0
Enum.description: LPTMR is disabled and internal logic is reset.

Enum.name: TEN_1
Enum.description: LPTMR is enabled.

Enum.name: TMS_0
Enum.description: Time Counter mode.

Enum.name: TMS_1
Enum.description: Pulse Counter mode.

Enum.name: TFC_0
Enum.description: CNR is reset whenever TCF is set.

Enum.name: TFC_1
Enum.description: CNR is reset on overflow.

Enum.name: TPP_0
Enum.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-high, and the CNR will increment on the rising-edge.

Enum.name: TPP_1
Enum.description: Pulse Counter input source is active-low, and the CNR will increment on the falling-edge.

Enum.name: TPS_0
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 0 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_1
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 1 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_2
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 2 is selected.

Enum.name: TPS_3
Enum.description: Pulse counter input 3 is selected.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Timer interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Timer interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TCF_0
Enum.description: The value of CNR is not equal to CMR and increments.

Enum.name: TCF_1
Enum.description: The value of CNR is equal to CMR and increments.

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Timer DMA Request disabled.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Timer DMA Request enabled.

Enum.name: PCS_0
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 0 selected.

Enum.name: PCS_1
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 1 selected.

Enum.name: PCS_2
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 2 selected.

Enum.name: PCS_3
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter clock 3 selected.

Enum.name: PBYP_0
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter is enabled.

Enum.name: PBYP_1
Enum.description: Prescaler/glitch filter is bypassed.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_0
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2; glitch filter does not support this configuration.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_1
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_2
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_3
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_4
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_5
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 64; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_6
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 128; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 64 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_7
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 256; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 128 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_8
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 512; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 256 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_9
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 1024; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 512 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_10
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 2048; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 1024 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_11
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 4096; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 2048 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_12
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 8192; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 4096 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_13
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 16,384; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 8192 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_14
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 32,768; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 16,384 rising clock edges.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_15
Enum.description: Prescaler divides the prescaler clock by 65,536; glitch filter recognizes change on input pin after 32,768 rising clock edges.

Register.name: TSI_GENCS
Register.description: TSI General Control and Status Register

BitField.name: EOSDMEO
BitField.description: End-of-Scan DMA Transfer Request Enable Only

Enum.name: EOSDMEO_0
Enum.description: Do not enable the End-of-Scan DMA transfer request only. Depending on ESOR state, either Out-of-Range or End-of-Scan can trigger a DMA transfer request and interrupt.

Enum.name: EOSDMEO_1
Enum.description: Only the End-of-Scan event can trigger a DMA transfer request. The Out-of-Range event only and always triggers an interrupt if TSIIE is set.

Enum.name: EOSF_0
Enum.description: Scan not complete.

Enum.name: EOSF_1
Enum.description: Scan complete.

Enum.name: SCNIP_0
Enum.description: No scan in progress.

Enum.name: SCNIP_1
Enum.description: Scan in progress.

Enum.name: STM_0
Enum.description: Software trigger scan.

Enum.name: STM_1
Enum.description: Hardware trigger scan.

Enum.name: STPE_0
Enum.description: TSI is disabled when MCU goes into low power mode.

Enum.name: STPE_1
Enum.description: Allows TSI to continue running in all low power modes.

Enum.name: TSIIEN_0
Enum.description: TSI interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: TSIIEN_1
Enum.description: TSI interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: TSIEN_0
Enum.description: TSI module disabled.

Enum.name: TSIEN_1
Enum.description: TSI module enabled.

Enum.name: DVOLT_0
Enum.description: Vm=0.3V; Vp=1.3V; dvolt=1.0V.

Enum.name: DVOLT_1
Enum.description: Vm=0.3V; Vp=1.6V; dvolt=1.3V.

Enum.name: DVOLT_2
Enum.description: Vm=0.3V; Vp=1.9V; dvolt=1.6V.

Enum.name: DVOLT_3
Enum.description: Vm=0.3V; Vp=2.3V; dvolt=2.0V.

Enum.name: ESOR_0
Enum.description: Out-of-range interrupt is allowed.

Enum.name: ESOR_1
Enum.description: End-of-scan interrupt is allowed.

Enum.name: SWTS_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: SWTS_1
Enum.description: Start a scan to determine which channel is specified by TSI_DATA[TSICH].

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: Interrupt is selected when the interrupt enable bit is set and the corresponding TSI events assert.

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA transfer request is selected when the interrupt enable bit is set and the corresponding TSI events assert.

Enum.name: BUS
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the bus clock.

Enum.name: LPO
Enum.description: Digital filters are clocked by the LPO clock.

Enum.name: DOWN
Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: UP
Enum.description: Internal pullup resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is not enabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Internal pullup or pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is disabled on the corresponding pin.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.description: Pin disabled (Alternative 0) (analog).

Enum.description: Pin Control Register fields [15:0] are not locked.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Interrupt Status Flag (ISF) is disabled.

Enum.name: INT_ZERO
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 0.

Enum.name: INT_RISING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on rising-edge.

Enum.name: INT_FALLING
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on falling-edge.

Enum.name: INT_BOTH
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt on either edge.

Enum.name: INT_ONE
Enum.description: ISF flag and Interrupt when logic 1.

Enum.name: NOT_DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is not detected.

Enum.name: DETECTED
Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. The flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.description: Internal pulldown resistor is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the corresponding PE field is set.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Passive input filter is enabled on the corresponding pin, if the pin is configured as a digital input. Refer to the device data sheet for filter characteristics.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High drive strength is configured on the corresponding pin, if pin is configured as a digital output.

Enum.description: Configured interrupt is detected. The flag remains set until a logic 1 is written to the flag. If the pin is configured for a level sensitive interrupt and the pin remains asserted, then the flag is set again immediately after it is cleared.

Enum.name: STOP_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: STOP_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip stop mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: WAIT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip wait mode.

Enum.name: DBG_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: DBG_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled in chip debug mode.

Enum.name: TST_0
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode disabled.

Enum.name: TST_1
Enum.description: Watchdog user mode enabled. (Watchdog test mode disabled.) After testing the watchdog, software should use this setting to indicate that the watchdog is functioning normally in user mode.

Enum.name: TST_2
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the low byte is used. CNT[CNTLOW] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALLOW].

Enum.name: TST_3
Enum.description: Watchdog test mode enabled, only the high byte is used. CNT[CNTHIGH] is compared with TOVAL[TOVALHIGH].

Enum.name: UPDATE_0
Enum.description: Updates not allowed. After the initial configuration, the watchdog cannot be later modified without forcing a reset.

Enum.name: UPDATE_1
Enum.description: Updates allowed. Software can modify the watchdog configuration registers within 128 bus clocks after performing the unlock write sequence.

Enum.name: INT_0
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are disabled. Watchdog resets are not delayed.

Enum.name: INT_1
Enum.description: Watchdog interrupts are enabled. Watchdog resets are delayed by 128 bus clocks from the interrupt vector fetch.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: Watchdog disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1
Enum.description: Watchdog enabled.

Enum.name: CLK_0
Enum.description: Bus clock

Enum.name: CLK_1
Enum.description: LPO clock

Enum.name: CLK_2
Enum.description: System oscillator clock (SOSC, from SCG)

Enum.name: CLK_3
Enum.description: Slow internal reference clock (SIRC, from SCG)

Enum.name: RCS_0
Enum.description: Reconfiguring WDOG.

Enum.name: RCS_1
Enum.description: Reconfiguration is successful.

Enum.name: ULK_0
Enum.description: WDOG is locked.

Enum.name: ULK_1
Enum.description: WDOG is unlocked.

Enum.name: PRES_0
Enum.description: 256 prescaler disabled.

Enum.name: PRES_1
Enum.description: 256 prescaler enabled.

BitField.name: CMD32EN
BitField.description: Enables or disables WDOG support for 32-bit (otherwise 16-bit or 8-bit) refresh/unlock command write words

Enum.name: CMD32EN_0
Enum.description: Disables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. Only 16-bit or 8-bit is supported.

Enum.name: CMD32EN_1
Enum.description: Enables support for 32-bit refresh/unlock command write words. 16-bit or 8-bit is NOT supported.

Enum.name: FLG_0
Enum.description: No interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: FLG_1
Enum.description: An interrupt occurred.

Enum.name: WIN_0
Enum.description: Window mode disabled.

Enum.name: WIN_1
Enum.description: Window mode enabled.

BitField.name: CNTLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: CNTHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the Watchdog Counter

BitField.name: TOVALLOW
BitField.description: Low byte of the timeout value

BitField.name: TOVALHIGH
BitField.description: High byte of the timeout value

Register.name: PWT_CS
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Control and Status Register

Enum.name: PWTOV_0
Enum.description: PWT counter no overflow.

Enum.name: PWTOV_1
Enum.description: PWT counter runs from 0xFFFF to 0x0000.

Enum.name: PWTRDY_0
Enum.description: PWT pulse width register(s) is not up-to-date.

Enum.name: PWTRDY_1
Enum.description: PWT pulse width register(s) has been updated.

BitField.name: FCTLE
BitField.description: First counter load enable after enable

Enum.name: FCTLE_0
Enum.description: Do not load the first counter values to corresponding registers

Enum.name: FCTLE_1
Enum.description: Load the first coutner value to corresponding registers depended by the PWTIN level

Enum.name: PWTSR_0
Enum.description: No action taken.

Enum.name: PWTSR_1
Enum.description: Writing 1 to this field will perform soft reset to PWT.

Enum.name: POVIE_0
Enum.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

Enum.name: POVIE_1
Enum.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTOV is set.

BitField.name: PRDYIE
BitField.description: PWT Pulse Width Data Ready Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: PRDYIE_0
Enum.description: Disable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

Enum.name: PRDYIE_1
Enum.description: Enable PWT to generate interrupt when PWTRDY is set.

Enum.name: PWTIE_0
Enum.description: Disables the PWT to generate interrupt.

Enum.name: PWTIE_1
Enum.description: Enables the PWT to generate interrupt.

Enum.name: PWTEN_0
Enum.description: The PWT is disabled.

Enum.name: PWTEN_1
Enum.description: The PWT is enabled.

Enum.name: PRE_0
Enum.description: Clock divided by 1.

Enum.name: PRE_1
Enum.description: Clock divided by 2.

Enum.name: PRE_2
Enum.description: Clock divided by 4.

Enum.name: PRE_3
Enum.description: Clock divided by 8.

Enum.name: PRE_4
Enum.description: Clock divided by 16.

Enum.name: PRE_5
Enum.description: Clock divided by 32.

Enum.name: PRE_6
Enum.description: Clock divided by 64.

Enum.name: PRE_7
Enum.description: Clock divided by 128.

BitField.name: TGL
BitField.description: PWTIN states Toggled from last state

Enum.name: TGL_0
Enum.description: The selected PWTIN hasn't changed its original states from last time.

Enum.name: TGL_1
Enum.description: The selected PWTIN has toggled its states.

Enum.name: PINSEL_0
Enum.description: PWTIN[0] is enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_1
Enum.description: PWTIN[1] is enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_2
Enum.description: PWTIN[2] enabled.

Enum.name: PINSEL_3
Enum.description: PWTIN[3] enabled.

Enum.name: PCLKS_0
Enum.description: BUS_CLK is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

Enum.name: PCLKS_1
Enum.description: Alternative clock is selected as the clock source of PWT counter.

Register.name: PWT_PPH
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: High

Register.name: PWT_PPL
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Positive Pulse Width Register: Loq

Register.name: PWT_NPH
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: High

Register.name: PWT_NPL
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Negative Pulse Width Register: Low

Register.name: PWT_CNTH
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: High

Register.name: PWT_CNTL
Register.description: Pulse Width Timer Counter Register: Low

BitField.name: SERVICE
BitField.description: The EWM refresh mechanism requires the CPU to write two values to the SERV register: a first data byte of 0xB4, followed by a second data byte of 0x2C

BitField.name: COMPAREL
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) minimum refresh time is required

BitField.name: COMPAREH
BitField.description: To prevent runaway code from changing this field, software should write to this field after a CPU reset even if the (default) maximum refresh time is required

BitField.name: CLK_DIV
BitField.description: Selected low power clock source for running the EWM counter can be prescaled as below

RegisterGroup.name: LPI2C0
RegisterGroup.description: The LPI2C Memory Map/Register Definition can be found here.

Enum.name: FEATURE_2
Enum.description: Master only with standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Master and slave with standard feature set.

Enum.name: MEN_0
Enum.description: Master logic is disabled.

Enum.name: MEN_1
Enum.description: Master logic is enabled.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Master logic is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Master logic is reset.

Enum.name: DOZEN_0
Enum.description: Master is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEN_1
Enum.description: Master is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_0
Enum.description: Master is disabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: DBGEN_1
Enum.description: Master is enabled in debug mode.

Enum.name: RTF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RTF_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: RRF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RRF_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is reset.

Enum.name: TDF_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not requested.

Enum.name: TDF_1
Enum.description: Transmit data is requested.

Enum.name: RDF_0
Enum.description: Receive Data is not ready.

Enum.name: RDF_1
Enum.description: Receive data is ready.

Enum.name: EPF_0
Enum.description: Master has not generated a STOP or Repeated START condition.

Enum.name: EPF_1
Enum.description: Master has generated a STOP or Repeated START condition.

Enum.name: SDF_0
Enum.description: Master has not generated a STOP condition.

Enum.name: SDF_1
Enum.description: Master has generated a STOP condition.

Enum.name: NDF_0
Enum.description: Unexpected NACK not detected.

Enum.name: NDF_1
Enum.description: Unexpected NACK was detected.

Enum.name: ALF_0
Enum.description: Master has not lost arbitration.

Enum.name: ALF_1
Enum.description: Master has lost arbitration.

Enum.name: FEF_0
Enum.description: No error.

Enum.name: FEF_1
Enum.description: Master sending or receiving data without START condition.

Enum.name: PLTF_0
Enum.description: Pin low timeout has not occurred or is disabled.

Enum.name: PLTF_1
Enum.description: Pin low timeout has occurred.

Enum.name: DMF_0
Enum.description: Have not received matching data.

Enum.name: DMF_1
Enum.description: Have received matching data.

Enum.name: MBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Master is idle.

Enum.name: MBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Master is busy.

Enum.name: BBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Bus is idle.

Enum.name: BBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Bus is busy.

Enum.name: TDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled

Enum.name: RDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: EPIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: EPIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: SDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: SDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: NDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: NDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: ALIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: ALIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: PLTIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: PLTIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: DMIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled

Enum.name: RDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: HREN_0
Enum.description: Host request input is disabled.

Enum.name: HREN_1
Enum.description: Host request input is enabled.

Enum.name: HRPOL_0
Enum.description: Active low.

Enum.name: HRPOL_1
Enum.description: Active high.

Enum.name: HRSEL_0
Enum.description: Host request input is pin LPI2C_HREQ.

Enum.name: HRSEL_1
Enum.description: Host request input is input trigger.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_0
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is disabled.

Enum.name: CIRFIFO_1
Enum.description: Circular FIFO is enabled.

Enum.name: RDMO_0
Enum.description: Received data is stored in the receive FIFO as normal.

Enum.name: RDMO_1
Enum.description: Received data is discarded unless the RMF is set.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_0
Enum.description: Divide by 1.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_1
Enum.description: Divide by 2.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_2
Enum.description: Divide by 4.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_3
Enum.description: Divide by 8.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_4
Enum.description: Divide by 16.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_5
Enum.description: Divide by 32.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_6
Enum.description: Divide by 64.

Enum.name: PRESCALE_7
Enum.description: Divide by 128.

Enum.name: AUTOSTOP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: AUTOSTOP_1
Enum.description: STOP condition is automatically generated whenever the transmit FIFO is empty and LPI2C master is busy.

BitField.name: IGNACK
BitField.description: When set, the received NACK field is ignored and assumed to be ACK

Enum.name: IGNACK_0
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will receive ACK and NACK normally.

Enum.name: IGNACK_1
Enum.description: LPI2C Master will treat a received NACK as if it was an ACK.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_0
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if SCL is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: TIMECFG_1
Enum.description: Pin Low Timeout Flag will set if either SCL or SDA is low for longer than the configured timeout.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Match disabled.

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 OR MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_4
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word equals MATCH0 AND 2nd data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_5
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word equals MATCH0 AND next data word equals MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_6
Enum.description: Match enabled (1st data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: MATCFG_7
Enum.description: Match enabled (any data word AND MATCH1 equals MATCH0 AND MATCH1).

Enum.name: PINCFG_0
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin open drain mode.

Enum.name: PINCFG_1
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin output only mode (ultra-fast mode).

Enum.name: PINCFG_2
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin push-pull mode.

Enum.name: PINCFG_3
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 4-pin push-pull mode.

Enum.name: PINCFG_4
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin open drain mode with separate LPI2C slave.

Enum.name: PINCFG_5
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin output only mode (ultra-fast mode) with separate LPI2C slave.

Enum.name: PINCFG_6
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 2-pin push-pull mode with separate LPI2C slave.

Enum.name: PINCFG_7
Enum.description: LPI2C configured for 4-pin push-pull mode (inverted outputs).

Enum.name: CMD_0
Enum.description: Transmit DATA[7:0].

Enum.name: CMD_1
Enum.description: Receive (DATA[7:0] + 1) bytes.

Enum.name: CMD_2
Enum.description: Generate STOP condition.

Enum.name: CMD_3
Enum.description: Receive and discard (DATA[7:0] + 1) bytes.

Enum.name: CMD_4
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0].

Enum.name: CMD_5
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0]. This transfer expects a NACK to be returned.

Enum.name: CMD_6
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0] using high speed mode.

Enum.name: CMD_7
Enum.description: Generate (repeated) START and transmit address in DATA[7:0] using high speed mode. This transfer expects a NACK to be returned.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is empty.

Enum.name: SEN_0
Enum.description: Slave mode is disabled.

Enum.name: SEN_1
Enum.description: Slave mode is enabled.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Slave logic is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Slave logic is reset.

Enum.name: FILTEN_0
Enum.description: Disable digital filter and output delay counter for slave mode.

Enum.name: FILTEN_1
Enum.description: Enable digital filter and output delay counter for slave mode.

Enum.name: FILTDZ_0
Enum.description: Filter remains enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: FILTDZ_1
Enum.description: Filter is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: RTF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RTF_1
Enum.description: Transmit Data Register is now empty.

Enum.name: RRF_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: RRF_1
Enum.description: Receive Data Register is now empty.

Enum.name: TDF_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not requested.

Enum.name: TDF_1
Enum.description: Transmit data is requested.

Enum.name: RDF_0
Enum.description: Receive Data is not ready.

Enum.name: RDF_1
Enum.description: Receive data is ready.

Enum.name: AVF_0
Enum.description: Address Status Register is not valid.

Enum.name: AVF_1
Enum.description: Address Status Register is valid.

Enum.name: TAF_0
Enum.description: Transmit ACK/NACK is not required.

Enum.name: TAF_1
Enum.description: Transmit ACK/NACK is required.

Enum.name: RSF_0
Enum.description: Slave has not detected a Repeated START condition.

Enum.name: RSF_1
Enum.description: Slave has detected a Repeated START condition.

Enum.name: SDF_0
Enum.description: Slave has not detected a STOP condition.

Enum.name: SDF_1
Enum.description: Slave has detected a STOP condition.

Enum.name: BEF_0
Enum.description: Slave has not detected a bit error.

Enum.name: BEF_1
Enum.description: Slave has detected a bit error.

Enum.name: FEF_0
Enum.description: FIFO underflow or overflow not detected.

Enum.name: FEF_1
Enum.description: FIFO underflow or overflow detected.

Enum.name: AM0F_0
Enum.description: Have not received ADDR0 matching address.

Enum.name: AM0F_1
Enum.description: Have received ADDR0 matching address.

Enum.name: AM1F_0
Enum.description: Have not received ADDR1 or ADDR0/ADDR1 range matching address.

Enum.name: AM1F_1
Enum.description: Have received ADDR1 or ADDR0/ADDR1 range matching address.

Enum.name: GCF_0
Enum.description: Slave has not detected the General Call Address or General Call Address disabled.

Enum.name: GCF_1
Enum.description: Slave has detected the General Call Address.

Enum.name: SARF_0
Enum.description: SMBus Alert Response disabled or not detected.

Enum.name: SARF_1
Enum.description: SMBus Alert Response enabled and detected.

Enum.name: SBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Slave is idle.

Enum.name: SBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Slave is busy.

Enum.name: BBF_0
Enum.description: I2C Bus is idle.

Enum.name: BBF_1
Enum.description: I2C Bus is busy.

Enum.name: TDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled

Enum.name: RDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: AVIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TAIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: TAIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: RSIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: RSIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: SDIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: SDIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: BEIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: BEIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: AM0IE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: AM0IE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: AM1F_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: AM1F_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: GCIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: GCIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: SARIE_0
Enum.description: Interrupt disabled.

Enum.name: SARIE_1
Enum.description: Interrupt enabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: TDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled

Enum.name: RDDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: RDDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: AVDE_0
Enum.description: DMA request disabled.

Enum.name: AVDE_1
Enum.description: DMA request enabled.

Enum.name: ADRSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: ADRSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: RXSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: RXSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: TXDSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: TXDSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: ACKSTALL_0
Enum.description: Clock stretching disabled.

Enum.name: ACKSTALL_1
Enum.description: Clock stretching enabled.

Enum.name: GCEN_0
Enum.description: General Call address is disabled.

Enum.name: GCEN_1
Enum.description: General call address is enabled.

Enum.name: SAEN_0
Enum.description: Disables match on SMBus Alert.

Enum.name: SAEN_1
Enum.description: Enables match on SMBus Alert.

Enum.name: TXCFG_0
Enum.description: Transmit Data Flag will only assert during a slave-transmit transfer when the transmit data register is empty.

Enum.name: TXCFG_1
Enum.description: Transmit Data Flag will assert whenever the transmit data register is empty.

Enum.name: RXCFG_0
Enum.description: Reading the receive data register will return receive data and clear the receive data flag.

Enum.name: RXCFG_1
Enum.description: Reading the receive data register when the address valid flag is set will return the address status register and clear the address valid flag. Reading the receive data register when the address valid flag is clear will return receive data and clear the receive data flag.

Enum.name: IGNACK_0
Enum.description: Slave will end transfer when NACK detected.

Enum.name: IGNACK_1
Enum.description: Slave will not end transfer when NACK detected.

Enum.name: HSMEN_0
Enum.description: Disables detection of Hs-mode master code.

Enum.name: HSMEN_1
Enum.description: Enables detection of Hs-mode master code.

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_0
Enum.description: Address match 0 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_1
Enum.description: Address match 0 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_2
Enum.description: Address match 0 (7-bit) or Address match 1 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_3
Enum.description: Address match 0 (10-bit) or Address match 1 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_4
Enum.description: Address match 0 (7-bit) or Address match 1 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_5
Enum.description: Address match 0 (10-bit) or Address match 1 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_6
Enum.description: From Address match 0 (7-bit) to Address match 1 (7-bit).

Enum.name: ADDRCFG_7
Enum.description: From Address match 0 (10-bit) to Address match 1 (10-bit).

Enum.name: ANV_0
Enum.description: RADDR is valid.

Enum.name: ANV_1
Enum.description: RADDR is not valid.

Enum.name: TXNACK_0
Enum.description: Transmit ACK for received word.

Enum.name: TXNACK_1
Enum.description: Transmit NACK for received word.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_0
Enum.description: The Receive Data Register is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPTY_1
Enum.description: The Receive Data Register is empty.

Enum.name: SOF_0
Enum.description: Indicates this is not the first data word since a (repeated) START or STOP condition.

Enum.name: SOF_1
Enum.description: Indicates this is the first data word since a (repeated) START or STOP condition.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is ANDed with the input trigger.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1

Enum.name: M10_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit to 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M10_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MAEN2_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN2_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA2].

Enum.name: MAEN1_0
Enum.description: Normal operation.

Enum.name: MAEN1_1
Enum.description: Enables automatic address matching or data matching mode for MATCH[MA1].

Enum.name: MA2F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA2F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA2

Enum.name: MA1F_0
Enum.description: Received data is not equal to MA1

Enum.name: MA1F_1
Enum.description: Received data is equal to MA1

Enum.name: PF_0
Enum.description: No parity error.

Enum.name: PF_1
Enum.description: Parity error.

Enum.name: FE_0
Enum.description: No framing error detected. This does not guarantee the framing is correct.

Enum.name: FE_1
Enum.description: Framing error.

Enum.name: NF_0
Enum.description: No noise detected.

Enum.name: NF_1
Enum.description: Noise detected in the received character in the DATA register.

Enum.name: OR_0
Enum.description: No overrun.

Enum.name: OR_1
Enum.description: Receive overrun (new LPUART data lost).

Enum.name: IDLE_0
Enum.description: No idle line detected.

Enum.name: IDLE_1
Enum.description: Idle line was detected.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_0
Enum.description: Receive data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RDRF_1
Enum.description: Receive data buffer full.

Enum.name: TC_0
Enum.description: Transmitter active (sending data, a preamble, or a break).

Enum.name: TC_1
Enum.description: Transmitter idle (transmission activity complete).

Enum.name: TDRE_0
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer full.

Enum.name: TDRE_1
Enum.description: Transmit data buffer empty.

Enum.name: RAF_0
Enum.description: LPUART receiver idle waiting for a start bit.

Enum.name: RAF_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver active (RXD input not idle).

Enum.name: LBKDE_0
Enum.description: LIN break detect is disabled, normal break character can be detected.

Enum.name: LBKDE_1
Enum.description: LIN break detect is enabled. LIN break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0) or 12 (if M = 1) or 13 (M10 = 1).

Enum.name: BRK13_0
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 9 to 13 bit times.

Enum.name: BRK13_1
Enum.description: Break character is transmitted with length of 12 to 15 bit times.

Enum.name: RWUID_0
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit does not get set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does not set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RWUID_1
Enum.description: During receive standby state (RWU = 1), the IDLE bit gets set upon detection of an idle character. During address match wakeup, the IDLE bit does set when an address does not match.

Enum.name: RXINV_0
Enum.description: Receive data not inverted.

Enum.name: RXINV_1
Enum.description: Receive data inverted.

Enum.name: MSBF_0
Enum.description: LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

Enum.name: MSBF_1
Enum.description: MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of CTRL[M], CTRL[PE] and BAUD[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of CTRL[M] and CTRL[PE].

BitField.name: RXEDGIF
BitField.description: RXD Pin Active Edge Interrupt Flag

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_0
Enum.description: No active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: RXEDGIF_1
Enum.description: An active edge on the receive pin has occurred.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_0
Enum.description: No LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: LBKDIF_1
Enum.description: LIN break character has been detected.

Enum.name: PT_0
Enum.description: Even parity.

Enum.name: PT_1
Enum.description: Odd parity.

Enum.name: PE_0
Enum.description: No hardware parity generation or checking.

Enum.name: PE_1
Enum.description: Parity enabled.

Enum.name: ILT_0
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after start bit.

Enum.name: ILT_1
Enum.description: Idle character bit count starts after stop bit.

Enum.name: WAKE_0
Enum.description: Configures RWU for idle-line wakeup.

Enum.name: WAKE_1
Enum.description: Configures RWU with address-mark wakeup.

Enum.name: M_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 9-bit data characters.

Enum.name: RSRC_0
Enum.description: Provided LOOPS is set, RSRC is cleared, selects internal loop back mode and the LPUART does not use the RXD pin.

Enum.name: RSRC_1
Enum.description: Single-wire LPUART mode where the TXD pin is connected to the transmitter output and receiver input.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_0
Enum.description: LPUART is enabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: DOZEEN_1
Enum.description: LPUART is disabled in Doze mode.

Enum.name: LOOPS_0
Enum.description: Normal operation - RXD and TXD use separate pins.

Enum.name: LOOPS_1
Enum.description: Loop mode or single-wire mode where transmitter outputs are internally connected to receiver input (see RSRC bit).

Enum.name: IDLECFG_0
Enum.description: 1 idle character

Enum.name: IDLECFG_1
Enum.description: 2 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_2
Enum.description: 4 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_3
Enum.description: 8 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_4
Enum.description: 16 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_5
Enum.description: 32 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_6
Enum.description: 64 idle characters

Enum.name: IDLECFG_7
Enum.description: 128 idle characters

Enum.name: M7_0
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 8-bit to 10-bit data characters.

Enum.name: M7_1
Enum.description: Receiver and transmitter use 7-bit data characters.

Enum.name: MA2IE_0
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA2IE_1
Enum.description: MA2F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_0
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt disabled

Enum.name: MA1IE_1
Enum.description: MA1F interrupt enabled

Enum.name: SBK_0
Enum.description: Normal transmitter operation.

Enum.name: SBK_1
Enum.description: Queue break character(s) to be sent.

Enum.name: RWU_0
Enum.description: Normal receiver operation.

Enum.name: RWU_1
Enum.description: LPUART receiver in standby waiting for wakeup condition.

Enum.name: RE_0
Enum.description: Receiver disabled.

Enum.name: RE_1
Enum.description: Receiver enabled.

Enum.name: TE_0
Enum.description: Transmitter disabled.

Enum.name: TE_1
Enum.description: Transmitter enabled.

Enum.name: ILIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from IDLE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ILIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when IDLE flag is 1.

Enum.name: RIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from RDRF disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: RIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when RDRF flag is 1.

Enum.name: TCIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TC disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TCIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TC flag is 1.

Enum.name: TIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from TDRE disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: TIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when TDRE flag is 1.

Enum.name: PEIE_0
Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

Enum.name: FEATURE_1
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set with MODEM/IrDA support.

Enum.name: RST_0
Enum.description: Module is not reset.

Enum.name: RST_1
Enum.description: Module is reset.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_0
Enum.description: Input trigger is disabled.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_1
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of RXD pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_2
Enum.description: Input trigger is used instead of CTS_B pin input.

Enum.name: TRGSEL_3
Enum.description: Input trigger is used to modulate the TXD pin output. The TXD pin output (after TXINV configuration) is ANDed with the input trigger.

Enum.name: SBNS_0
Enum.description: One stop bit.

Enum.name: SBNS_1
Enum.description: Two stop bits.

BitField.name: RXEDGIE
BitField.description: RX Input Active Edge Interrupt Enable

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[RXEDGIF] are disabled.

Enum.name: RXEDGIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt is requested when STAT[RXEDGIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: LBKDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupts from STAT[LBKDIF] flag are disabled (use polling).

Enum.name: LBKDIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when STAT[LBKDIF] flag is 1.

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_0
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is supported

Enum.name: RESYNCDIS_1
Enum.description: Resynchronization during received data word is disabled

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_0
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: BOTHEDGE_1
Enum.description: Receiver samples input data using the rising and falling edge of the baud rate clock.

Enum.name: MATCFG_0
Enum.description: Address Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_1
Enum.description: Idle Match Wakeup

Enum.name: MATCFG_2
Enum.description: Match On and Match Off

Enum.name: MATCFG_3
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: OSR_0

Enum.name: OSR_3

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 20.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 21.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 22.

Enum.name: OSR_22
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 23.

Enum.name: OSR_23
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 24.

Enum.name: OSR_24
Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 25.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 26.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 27.

Enum.description: Oversampling ratio of 28.
