Enum.description: PF interrupts disabled; use polling).

Enum.name: PEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when PF is set.

Enum.name: FEIE_0
Enum.description: FE interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: FEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when FE is set.

Enum.name: NEIE_0
Enum.description: NF interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: NEIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when NF is set.

Enum.name: ORIE_0
Enum.description: OR interrupts disabled; use polling.

Enum.name: ORIE_1
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt requested when OR is set.

Enum.name: TXINV_0
Enum.description: Transmit data not inverted.

Enum.name: TXINV_1
Enum.description: Transmit data inverted.

BitField.name: TXDIR
BitField.description: TXD Pin Direction in Single-Wire Mode

Enum.name: TXDIR_0
Enum.description: TXD pin is an input in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: TXDIR_1
Enum.description: TXD pin is an output in single-wire mode.

Enum.name: IDLINE_0
Enum.description: Receiver was not idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: IDLINE_1
Enum.description: Receiver was idle before receiving this character.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer contains valid data.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty, data returned on read is not valid.

Enum.name: FRETSC_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a frame error on read, or transmit a normal character on write.

Enum.name: FRETSC_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a frame error, or transmit an idle or break character on transmit.

Enum.name: PARITYE_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without a parity error.

Enum.name: PARITYE_1
Enum.description: The dataword was received with a parity error.

Enum.name: NOISY_0
Enum.description: The dataword was received without noise.

Enum.name: NOISY_1
Enum.description: The data was received with noise.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_0
Enum.description: CTS has no effect on the transmitter.

Enum.name: TXCTSE_1
Enum.description: Enables clear-to-send operation. The transmitter checks the state of CTS each time it is ready to send a character. If CTS is asserted, the character is sent. If CTS is deasserted, the signal TXD remains in the mark state and transmission is delayed until CTS is asserted. Changes in CTS as a character is being sent do not affect its transmission.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The transmitter has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: TXRTSE_1
Enum.description: When a character is placed into an empty transmitter data buffer , RTS asserts one bit time before the start bit is transmitted. RTS deasserts one bit time after all characters in the transmitter data buffer and shift register are completely sent, including the last stop bit.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_0
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active low.

Enum.name: TXRTSPOL_1
Enum.description: Transmitter RTS is active high.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_0
Enum.description: The receiver has no effect on RTS.

Enum.name: RXRTSE_1
Enum.description: no description available

Enum.name: TXCTSC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled at the start of each character.

Enum.name: TXCTSC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is sampled when the transmitter is idle.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_0
Enum.description: CTS input is the CTS_B pin.

Enum.name: TXCTSSRC_1
Enum.description: CTS input is the inverted Receiver Match result.

Enum.name: IREN_0
Enum.description: IR disabled.

Enum.name: IREN_1
Enum.description: IR enabled.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Receive FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords.

Enum.name: RXFE_0
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: RXFE_1
Enum.description: Receive FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicted by RXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 1 dataword.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 4 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_2
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 8 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_3
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 16 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_4
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 32 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_5
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 64 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_6
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 128 datawords.

Enum.name: TXFIFOSIZE_7
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO/Buffer depth = 256 datawords

Enum.name: TXFE_0
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is not enabled. Buffer is depth 1.

Enum.name: TXFE_1
Enum.description: Transmit FIFO is enabled. Buffer is depth indicated by TXFIFOSIZE.

Enum.name: RXUFE_0
Enum.description: RXUF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXUFE_1
Enum.description: RXUF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_0
Enum.description: TXOF flag does not generate an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: TXOFE_1
Enum.description: TXOF flag generates an interrupt to the host.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_0
Enum.description: Disable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_1
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 1 character.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_2
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 2 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_3
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 4 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_4
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 8 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_5
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 16 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_6
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 32 characters.

Enum.name: RXIDEN_7
Enum.description: Enable RDRF assertion due to partially filled FIFO when receiver is idle for 64 characters.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: RXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the receive FIFO/buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_0
Enum.description: No flush operation occurs.

Enum.name: TXFLUSH_1
Enum.description: All data in the transmit FIFO/Buffer is cleared out.

Enum.name: RXUF_0
Enum.description: No receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXUF_1
Enum.description: At least one receive buffer underflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_0
Enum.description: No transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: TXOF_1
Enum.description: At least one transmit buffer overflow has occurred since the last time the flag was cleared.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Receive buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: RXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Receive buffer is empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_0
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is not empty.

Enum.name: TXEMPT_1
Enum.description: Transmit buffer is empty.

RegisterGroup.name: CMP0
RegisterGroup.description: High-Speed Comparator (CMP), Voltage Reference (VREF) Digital-to-Analog Converter (DAC), and Analog Mux (ANMUX)

BitField.name: HYSTCTR
BitField.description: Comparator hard block hysteresis control. See chip data sheet to get the actual hysteresis value with each level

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_0
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 0 hysteresis internally.

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_1
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 1 hysteresis internally.

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_2
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 2 hysteresis internally.

Enum.name: HYSTCTR_3
Enum.description: The hard block output has level 3 hysteresis internally.

BitField.name: OFFSET
BitField.description: Comparator hard block offset control. See chip data sheet to get the actual offset value with each level

Enum.name: OFFSET_0
Enum.description: The comparator hard block output has level 0 offset internally.

Enum.name: OFFSET_1
Enum.description: The comparator hard block output has level 1 offset internally.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_0
Enum.description: Filter is disabled. If SE = 1, then COUT is a logic zero (this is not a legal state, and is not recommended). If SE = 0, COUT = COUTA.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_1
Enum.description: 1 consecutive sample must agree (comparator output is simply sampled).

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_2
Enum.description: 2 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_3
Enum.description: 3 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_4
Enum.description: 4 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_5
Enum.description: 5 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_6
Enum.description: 6 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: FILTER_CNT_7
Enum.description: 7 consecutive samples must agree.

Enum.name: EN_0
Enum.description: Analog Comparator is disabled.

Enum.name: EN_1
Enum.description: Analog Comparator is enabled.

Enum.name: OPE_0
Enum.description: When OPE is 0, the comparator output (after window/filter settings dependent on software configuration) is not available to a packaged pin.

Enum.name: OPE_1
Enum.description: When OPE is 1, and if the software has configured the comparator to own a packaged pin, the comparator is available in a packaged pin.

Enum.name: COS_0
Enum.description: Set CMPO to equal COUT (filtered comparator output).

Enum.name: COS_1
Enum.description: Set CMPO to equal COUTA (unfiltered comparator output).

Enum.name: INVT_0
Enum.description: Does not invert the comparator output.

Enum.name: INVT_1
Enum.description: Inverts the comparator output.

Enum.name: PMODE_0
Enum.description: Low Speed (LS) comparison mode is selected.

Enum.name: PMODE_1
Enum.description: High Speed (HS) comparison mode is selected, in VLPx mode, or Stop mode switched to Low Speed (LS) mode.

Enum.name: WE_0
Enum.description: Windowing mode is not selected.

Enum.name: WE_1
Enum.description: Windowing mode is selected.

Enum.name: SE_0
Enum.description: Sampling mode is not selected.

Enum.name: SE_1
Enum.description: Sampling mode is selected.

Enum.name: CFF_0
Enum.description: A falling edge has not been detected on COUT.

Enum.name: CFF_1
Enum.description: A falling edge on COUT has occurred.

Enum.name: CFR_0
Enum.description: A rising edge has not been detected on COUT.

Enum.name: CFR_1
Enum.description: A rising edge on COUT has occurred.

Enum.name: IEF_0
Enum.description: Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: IEF_1
Enum.description: Interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: IER_0
Enum.description: Interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: IER_1
Enum.description: Interrupt is enabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_0
Enum.description: DMA is disabled.

Enum.name: DMAEN_1
Enum.description: DMA is enabled.

Enum.name: VRSEL_0
Enum.description: Vin1 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

Enum.name: VRSEL_1
Enum.description: Vin2 is selected as resistor ladder network supply reference Vin.

Enum.name: DACEN_0
Enum.description: DAC is disabled.

Enum.name: DACEN_1
Enum.description: DAC is enabled.

BitField.name: INNSEL
BitField.description: Selection of the input to the negative port of the comparator

Enum.name: INNSEL_0
Enum.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

Enum.name: INNSEL_1
Enum.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

BitField.name: INPSEL
BitField.description: Selection of the input to the positive port of the comparator

Enum.name: INPSEL_0
Enum.description: IN0, from the 8-bit DAC output

Enum.name: INPSEL_1
Enum.description: IN1, from the analog 8-1 mux

BitField.name: ACOn
BitField.description: The result of the input comparison for channel n

BitField.name: INITMOD
BitField.description: Comparator and DAC initialization delay modulus.

Enum.name: INITMOD_0
Enum.description: The modulus is set to 64 (same with 111111).

Enum.name: NSAM_0
Enum.description: The comparison result is sampled as soon as the active channel is scanned in one round-robin clock.

Enum.name: NSAM_1
Enum.description: The sampling takes place 1 round-robin clock cycle after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.name: NSAM_2
Enum.description: The sampling takes place 2 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.name: NSAM_3
Enum.description: The sampling takes place 3 round-robin clock cycles after the next cycle of the round-robin clock.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_0
Enum.description: Channel 0 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_1
Enum.description: Channel 1 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_2
Enum.description: Channel 2 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_3
Enum.description: Channel 3 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_4
Enum.description: Channel 4 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_5
Enum.description: Channel 5 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_6
Enum.description: Channel 6 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMXCH_7
Enum.description: Channel 7 is selected as the fixed reference input for the fixed mux port.

Enum.name: FXMP_0
Enum.description: The Plus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Minus port are swept in each round.

Enum.name: FXMP_1
Enum.description: The Minus port is fixed. Only the inputs to the Plus port are swept in each round.

Enum.name: RRIE_0
Enum.description: The round-robin interrupt is disabled.

Enum.name: RRIE_1
Enum.description: The round-robin interrupt is enabled when a comparison result changes from the last sample.

Enum.name: RRE_0
Enum.description: Round-robin operation is disabled.

Enum.name: RRE_1
Enum.description: Round-robin operation is enabled.

Register.name: PMC_LVDSC1
Register.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 1 Register

Enum.name: LVDRE_0
Enum.description: No system resets on low voltage detect events.

Enum.name: LVDRE_1
Enum.description: If the supply voltage falls below VLVD, a system reset will be generated.

Enum.name: LVDIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

Enum.name: LVDIE_1
Enum.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVDF = 1

Enum.name: LVDF_0
Enum.description: Low-voltage event not detected

Enum.name: LVDF_1
Enum.description: Low-voltage event detected

Register.name: PMC_LVDSC2
Register.description: Low Voltage Detect Status and Control 2 Register

Enum.name: LVWIE_0
Enum.description: Hardware interrupt disabled (use polling)

Enum.name: LVWIE_1
Enum.description: Request a hardware interrupt when LVWF=1

Enum.name: LVWF_0
Enum.description: Low-voltage warning event not detected

Enum.name: LVWF_1
Enum.description: Low-voltage warning event detected

Enum.name: BIASEN_0
Enum.description: Biasing disabled, core logic can run in full performance

Enum.name: BIASEN_1
Enum.description: Biasing enabled, core logic is slower and there are restrictions in allowed system clock speed (see Data Sheet for details)

Enum.name: CLKBIASDIS_0
Enum.description: No effect

Enum.name: CLKBIASDIS_1
Enum.description: In STOP or VLPS mode the bias currents and reference voltages for the following clock modules are disabled: SIRC, FIRC, PLL. (if available on device)

BitField.name: REGFPM
BitField.description: Regulator in Full Performance Mode Status Bit

Enum.name: REGFPM_0
Enum.description: Regulator is in low power mode or transition to/from

Enum.name: REGFPM_1
Enum.description: Regulator is in full performance mode

Enum.name: LPOSTAT_0
Enum.description: Low power oscillator in low phase

Enum.name: LPOSTAT_1
Enum.description: Low power oscillator in high phase

Enum.name: LPODIS_0
Enum.description: Low power oscillator enabled

Enum.name: LPODIS_1
Enum.description: Low power oscillator disabled

Enum.name: FEATURE_0
Enum.description: Standard features implemented

Enum.name: EHSRUN_0
Enum.description: The feature is not available.

Enum.name: EHSRUN_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.name: ELLS_0
Enum.description: The feature is not available.

Enum.name: ELLS_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.name: ELLS2_0
Enum.description: The feature is not available.

Enum.name: ELLS2_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.name: EVLLS0_0
Enum.description: The feature is not available.

Enum.name: EVLLS0_1
Enum.description: The feature is available.

Enum.name: AVLP_0
Enum.description: VLPR, VLPW, and VLPS are not allowed.

Enum.name: AVLP_1
Enum.description: VLPR, VLPW, and VLPS are allowed.

Enum.name: STOPM_0
Enum.description: Normal Stop (STOP)

Enum.name: STOPM_2
Enum.description: Very-Low-Power Stop (VLPS)

Enum.name: STOPA_0
Enum.description: The previous stop mode entry was successful.

Enum.name: STOPA_1
Enum.description: The previous stop mode entry was aborted.

Enum.name: RUNM_0
Enum.description: Normal Run mode (RUN)

Enum.name: RUNM_2
Enum.description: Very-Low-Power Run mode (VLPR)

Enum.name: PSTOPO_0
Enum.description: STOP - Normal Stop mode

Enum.name: PSTOPO_1
Enum.description: PSTOP1 - Partial Stop with both system and bus clocks disabled

Enum.name: PSTOPO_2
Enum.description: PSTOP2 - Partial Stop with system clock disabled and bus clock enabled

Enum.name: FEATURE_3
Enum.description: Standard feature set.

Enum.name: PDD_1
Enum.description: Pin is configured as general-purpose output, for the GPIO function.

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

Enum.name: PENDSTCLR_0
Enum.description: no effect

Enum.name: PENDSTCLR_1
Enum.description: removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

Enum.name: PENDSTSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

Enum.name: PENDSTSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

Enum.name: PENDSVCLR_0
Enum.description: no effect

Enum.name: PENDSVCLR_1
Enum.description: removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

Enum.name: PENDSVSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

Enum.name: PENDSVSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_0
Enum.description: write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

Enum.name: NMIPENDSET_1
Enum.description: write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SCB_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.name: SYSRESETREQ_0
Enum.description: no system reset request

Enum.name: SYSRESETREQ_1
Enum.description: asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_0
Enum.description: o not sleep when returning to Thread mode

Enum.name: SLEEPONEXIT_1
Enum.description: enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

Enum.name: SLEEPDEEP_1
Enum.description: deep sleep

Enum.name: SEVONPEND_0
Enum.description: only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

Enum.name: SEVONPEND_1
Enum.description: enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Always reads as one, indicates that all unaligned accesses generate a HardFault

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

Register.name: SCB_SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

Enum.name: SVCALLPENDED_0
Enum.description: exception is not pending

Enum.name: SVCALLPENDED_1
Enum.description: exception is pending

Enum.name: HALTED_0
Enum.description: No active halt request debug event

Enum.name: HALTED_1
Enum.description: Halt request debug event active

Enum.name: BKPT_0
Enum.description: No current breakpoint debug event

Enum.name: BKPT_1
Enum.description: At least one current breakpoint debug event

Enum.name: DWTTRAP_0
Enum.description: No current debug events generated by the DWT

Enum.name: DWTTRAP_1
Enum.description: At least one current debug event generated by the DWT

Enum.name: VCATCH_0
Enum.description: No Vector catch triggered

Enum.name: VCATCH_1
Enum.description: Vector catch triggered

Enum.name: EXTERNAL_0
Enum.description: No EDBGRQ debug event

Enum.name: EXTERNAL_1
Enum.description: EDBGRQ debug event

Enum.name: ENABLE_0
Enum.description: counter disabled

Enum.name: ENABLE_1
Enum.description: counter enabled

Enum.name: TICKINT_0
Enum.description: counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request

Enum.name: TICKINT_1
Enum.description: counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

Enum.name: CLKSOURCE_0
Enum.description: external clock

Enum.name: CLKSOURCE_1
Enum.description: processor clock

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

Enum.name: SKEW_0
Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is exact

Enum.name: SKEW_1
Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency

Enum.name: NOREF_0
Enum.description: The reference clock is provided

Enum.name: NOREF_1
Enum.description: The reference clock is not provided

Register.name: DHCSR_Read
Register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

BitField.name: C_DEBUGEN
BitField.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

BitField.name: C_HALT
BitField.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_HALT_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_HALT_1
Enum.description: Halt the processor.

BitField.name: C_STEP
BitField.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_STEP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_STEP_1
Enum.description: Step the processor.

BitField.name: C_MASKINTS
BitField.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_0
Enum.description: Do not mask.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_1
Enum.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

BitField.name: S_REGRDY
BitField.description: S_REGRDY bit. A handshake flag for transfers through the DCRDR:- Writing to DCRSR clears the bit to 0.- Completion of the DCRDR transfer then sets the bit to 1.This bit is valid only when the processor is in Debug state, otherwise the bit is UNKNOWN.

Enum.name: S_REGRDY_0
Enum.description: There has been a write to the DCRDR, but the transfer is not complete.

Enum.name: S_REGRDY_1
Enum.description: The transfer to or from the DCRDR is complete.

BitField.name: S_HALT
BitField.description: S_HALT bit. Indicates whether the processor is in Debug state.

Enum.name: S_HALT_0
Enum.description: Not in Debug state.

Enum.name: S_HALT_1
Enum.description: In Debug state.

BitField.name: S_SLEEP
BitField.description: S_SLEEP bit. Indicates whether the processor is sleeping.The debugger must set the C_HALT bit to 1 to gain control, or wait for an interrupt or other wakeup event to wakeup the system.

Enum.name: S_SLEEP_0
Enum.description: Not sleeping.

BitField.name: S_LOCKUP
BitField.description: S_LOCKUP bit. Indicates whether the processor is locked up because of an unrecoverable exception.This bit can only be read as 1 by a remote debugger, using the DAP. The value of 1 indicates that the processor is running but locked up.The bit clears to 0 when the processor enters Debug state.

Enum.name: S_LOCKUP_0
Enum.description: Not locked up

Enum.name: S_LOCKUP_1
Enum.description: Locked up

BitField.name: S_RETIRE_ST
BitField.description: S_RETIRE_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has completed the execution of an instruction since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.A debugger can check this bit to determine if the processor is stalled on a load, store or fetch access.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on or Local reset, but then is set to 1 as soon as the processor executes and retires an instruction.

Enum.name: S_RETIRE_ST_0
Enum.description: No instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

Enum.name: S_RETIRE_ST_1
Enum.description: At least one instruction retired since last DHCSR read.

BitField.name: S_RESET_ST
BitField.description: S_RESET_ST bit. Indicates whether the processor has been reset since the last read of DHCSR.This is a sticky bit, that clears to 0 on a read of DHCSR.

Enum.name: S_RESET_ST_0
Enum.description: No reset since last DHCSR read.

Enum.name: S_RESET_ST_1
Enum.description: At least one reset since last DHCSR read.

Register.name: DHCSR_Write
Register.description: Debug Halting Control and Status Register

BitField.name: C_DEBUGEN
BitField.description: Halting debug enable bit. If a debugger writes to DHCSR to change the value of this bit from 0 to 1, it must also write 0 to the C_MASKINTS bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.This bit can only be set to 1 from the DAP, it cannot be set to 1 under software control.This bit is 0 after a Power-on reset.

BitField.name: C_HALT
BitField.description: Processor halt bit. This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_HALT_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_HALT_1
Enum.description: Halt the processor.

BitField.name: C_STEP
BitField.description: Processor step bit.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_STEP_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: C_STEP_1
Enum.description: Step the processor.

BitField.name: C_MASKINTS
BitField.description: C_MASKINTS bit. When debug is enabled, the debugger can write to this bit to mask PendSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts. The effect of any attempt to change the value of this bit is UNPREDICTABLE unless both:- before the write to DHCSR, the value of the C_HALT bit is 1.- the write to the DHCSR that changes the C_MASKINTS bit also writes 1 to the C_HALT bit.This means that a single write to DHCSR cannot set the C_HALT to 0 and change the value of the C_MASKINTS bit.The bit does not affect NMI. When DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the value of this bit is UNKNOWN.This bit is UNKNOWN after a Power-on reset.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_0
Enum.description: Do not mask.

Enum.name: C_MASKINTS_1
Enum.description: Mask PenSV, SysTick and external configurable interrupts.

BitField.name: DBGKEY
BitField.description: Debug key:Software must write 0xA05F to this field to enable write accesses to bits [15:0], otherwise the processor ignores the write access.

BitField.name: REGSEL
BitField.description: REGSEL bits. Specifies the ARM core register, special-purpose register, or Floating-point extension register, to transfer.

BitField.name: REGWnR
BitField.description: REGWnR bit. Specifies the access type for the transfer.

BitField.name: DBGTMP
BitField.description: DBGTMP bits. Data temporary cache, for reading and writing the ARM core registers, special-purpose registers, and Floating-point extension registers.The value of this register is UNKNOWN:- on reset- if the processor is in Debug state, the debugger has written to DCRSR since entering Debug state and DHCSR.S_REGRDY is set to 0.

Register.name: DEMCR
Register.description: Debug Exception and Monitor Control Register

BitField.name: VC_CORERESET
BitField.description: VC_CORERESET bit. Enable Reset Vector Catch. This causes a Local reset to halt a running system.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_CORERESET_0
Enum.description: Reset Vector Catch disabled.

Enum.name: VC_CORERESET_1
Enum.description: Reset Vector Catch enabled.

BitField.name: VC_HARDERR
BitField.description: VC_HARDERR bit. Enable halting debug trap on a HardFault exception.If DHCSR.C_DEBUGEN is set to 0, the processor ignores the value of this bit.

Enum.name: VC_HARDERR_0
Enum.description: Halting debug trap disabled.

Enum.name: VC_HARDERR_1
Enum.description: Halting debug trap enabled.

BitField.name: DWTENA
BitField.description: DWTENA bit. Global enable for all features configured and controlled by the DWT unit.

Enum.name: DWTENA_0
Enum.description: DWT disabled.

Enum.name: DWTENA_1
Enum.description: DWT enabled.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_4
Enum.description: Instruction fetch.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_5
Enum.description: Data operand read.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_6
Enum.description: Data operand write.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_7
Enum.description: Data operand (read + write).

Enum.name: DATAVMATCH_0
Enum.description: Perform address comparison.

Enum.name: DATAVMATCH_1
Enum.description: Perform data value comparison.

Enum.name: MATCHED_0
Enum.description: No match.

Enum.name: MATCHED_1
Enum.description: Match occurred.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_4
Enum.description: Instruction fetch.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_5
Enum.description: Data operand read.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_6
Enum.description: Data operand write.

Enum.name: FUNCTION_7
Enum.description: Data operand (read + write).

Enum.name: MATCHED_0
Enum.description: No match.

Enum.name: MATCHED_1
Enum.description: Match occurred.

Enum.name: ACOMP0_0
Enum.description: Trigger TSTOP based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT0[MATCHED].

Enum.name: ACOMP0_1
Enum.description: Trigger TSTART based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT0[MATCHED].

Enum.name: ACOMP1_0
Enum.description: Trigger TSTOP based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT1[MATCHED].

Enum.name: ACOMP1_1
Enum.description: Trigger TSTART based on the assertion of MTBDWT_FCT1[MATCHED].

BitField.name: ASC
BitField.description: Each bit in the ASC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the crossbar switch's slave input port.

Enum.name: ASC_0
Enum.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is absent.

Enum.name: ASC_1
Enum.description: A bus slave connection to AXBS input port n is present.

BitField.name: AMC
BitField.description: Each bit in the AMC field indicates whether there is a corresponding connection to the AXBS master input port.

Enum.name: AMC_0
Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is absent

Enum.name: AMC_1
Enum.description: A bus master connection to AXBS input port n is present

Enum.name: ARB_0
Enum.description: Fixed-priority arbitration for the crossbar masters

Enum.name: ARB_1
Enum.description: Round-robin arbitration for the crossbar masters

Enum.name: DFCDA_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller data caching

Enum.name: DFCDA_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller data caching.

Enum.name: DFCIC_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller instruction caching.

Enum.name: DFCIC_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller instruction caching.

Enum.name: DFCC_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller cache.

Enum.name: DFCC_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller cache.

Enum.name: EFDS_0
Enum.description: Disable flash data speculation.

Enum.name: EFDS_1
Enum.description: Enable flash data speculation.

Enum.name: DFCS_0
Enum.description: Enable flash controller speculation.

Enum.name: DFCS_1
Enum.description: Disable flash controller speculation.

Enum.name: ESFC_0
Enum.description: Disable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.

Enum.name: ESFC_1
Enum.description: Enable stalling flash controller when flash is busy.

Enum.name: CPOREQ_0
Enum.description: Request is cleared.

Enum.name: CPOREQ_1
Enum.description: Request Compute Operation.

Enum.name: CPOACK_0
Enum.description: Compute operation entry has not completed or compute operation exit has completed.

Enum.name: CPOACK_1
Enum.description: Compute operation entry has completed or compute operation exit has not completed.

Enum.name: CPOWOI_0
Enum.description: No effect.

Enum.name: CPOWOI_1
Enum.description: When set, the CPOREQ is cleared on any interrupt or exception vector fetch.

Enum.name: SRT_0
Enum.description: No operation initiated

Enum.name: SRT_1
Enum.description: If CSR[DFS] = 1, then initiate a divide calculation, else ignore

Enum.name: USGN_0
Enum.description: Perform a signed divide

Enum.name: USGN_1
Enum.description: Perform an unsigned divide

Enum.name: REM_0
Enum.description: Return the quotient in the RES for the divide calculation

Enum.name: REM_1
Enum.description: Return the remainder in the RES for the divide calculation

Enum.name: DZE_0
Enum.description: Reads of the RES register return the register contents

Enum.name: DZE_1
Enum.description: If CSR[DZ] = 1, an attempted read of RES register is error terminated to signal a divide-by-zero, else the register contents are returned

Enum.name: DZ_0
Enum.description: The last divide operation had a non-zero divisor, that is, DSOR != 0

Enum.name: DZ_1
Enum.description: The last divide operation had a zero divisor, that is, DSOR = 0

Enum.name: DFS_0
Enum.description: A divide operation is initiated by a write to the DSOR register

Enum.name: DFS_1
Enum.description: A divide operation is initiated by a write to the CSR register with CSR[SRT] = 1

Enum.name: SQRT_0
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was not a square root

Enum.name: SQRT_1
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was a square root

Enum.name: DIV_0
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was not a divide

Enum.name: DIV_1
Enum.description: Current or last MMDVSQ operation was a divide

Enum.name: BUSY_0
Enum.description: MMDVSQ is idle

Enum.name: BUSY_1
Enum.description: MMDVSQ is busy performing a divide or square root calculation

Enum.name: PDO_1
Enum.description: Logic level 1 is driven on pin, provided pin is configured for general-purpose output.
